com.escape.games.service
Class RenderServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.escape.games.service.RenderServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderContext
Direct Known Subclasses:
RenderService
public abstract class RenderServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderContext

Render service core. Must run on the GL thread, not the Game thread! This implementation maintains 3 matrices:

  • View (V): camera position/focal-point.
  • Projection (P): viewport width/height plus z near/far. Creates a frustum.
  • View/Projection (VP): combined matrix.

Author:
escape-llc

Method Detail

updateViewMatrix

protected void updateViewMatrix()
Update V and VP matrices in response to settings. Must be called after updating camera-position, camera-looks-at, proj-matrix. Must hold update lock.

updateProjMatrix

protected void updateProjMatrix()
Update P and VP matrix in response to settings. Must be called after updating viewport, z-planes. Must hold update lock.

public void suspend()
Stop drawing while GL resources are being reacquired.

activateShader

public void activateShader(com.escape.games.resource.Shader sx)
Manage switch of shaders. If we are on the same shader, do nothing. Must hold update lock.

Specified by:
activateShader in interface RenderContext
Parameters:
sx - Shader to activate and become current shader.

setProjection

public void setProjection(int width,
                          int height)
Reset the projection matrix. Obtains update lock.

Parameters:
width - view width.
height - view height.

setNearFar

public void setNearFar(float near,
                       float far)
Set the z-clipping projection planes. These are relative distances FORWARD from camera-position. Must call before setProjection() is called. Obtains update lock.

Parameters:
near - distance to near clip plane.
far - distance to far clip plane.

setProjection

public void setProjection(int width,
                          int height,
                          float zn,
                          float zf)
Reset the projection matrix and z-clipping planes together. Obtains update lock.

Parameters:
width - view width.
height - view height.

getViewportSize

public void getViewportSize(android.graphics.Point vp)
Get the current viewport dimensions. Not valid before setProjection() is called. Obtains update lock.

Parameters:
vp - receives vp width/height.

project

public void project(float xx,
                    float yy,
                    float zz,
                    float[] win,
                    boolean invertY)
Project point in World space to point in Window space. Model coords should be transformed by M matrix. Optionally invert Y-axis so it lines up with native screen coordinates. Obtains update lock.

Parameters:
xx - World-x
yy - World-y
zz - World-z
win - Output Window space.
invertY - true: invert Y-axis value by viewport.y

unproject

public void unproject(float xx,
                      float yy,
                      float zz,
                      float[] world)
Unproject a point in Window space to point in World space.

Parameters:
xx - Window-x
yy - Window-y
zz - Window-z
world - Output World space.
